snippet: The superintendent and three current or former city school officials in Steubenville, Ohio, pleaded not guilty on Friday to charges related to the 2012 rape of a 16-year-old girl.
abstract: Superintendent Michael McVey and three current or former city school officials in Steubenville, Ohio, plead not guilty to charges related to 2012 rape of 16-year-old girl by two football players; McVey, who is free on personal recognizance bond, has been accused of evidence tampering, obstruction of justice and other charges.
lead_paragraph: The superintendent and three current or former city school officials in Steubenville, Ohio, pleaded not guilty on Friday to charges related to the 2012 rape of a 16-year-old girl.

headline.main: Ohio: School Officials Plead Not Guilty After Rape
headline.print_headline: Ohio: School Officials Plead Not Guilty After Rape
